It's Front-End Conf Week!

We're excited to see everyone this week! This email will have some location details and some ideas for things to check out if you're not regularly in St. Pete.

It will Rain

It looks like a 90% chance of rain on Friday and if it goes anything like the past 3 years, it will start raining when we have to leave for lunch and the party. If you can bring or grab an umbrella or poncho, we recommend it.

No Receipts Necessary

We love that Tito gave you nice, professional receipts but we have a master list that we'll use for your badges. If there is any discrepancy, we would only check your photo ID.

Updates via anonymous text with Gather

Gather is a service from MailChimp that allows us to send texts to a list without any of us having to share our phone info. Sending expires July 13th.
If you'd like to get texts with any important info or info about social gatherings, sign up for the conference list. We'll likely send 0-5 per day, Wednesday through Saturday.

Parking at the Palladium

The best place to park at the Palladium is the parking lot on the side of the building, on the same side of the street. There is a smaller overflow lot across the street as well.

Parking elsewhere in St. Pete

If you street park, please pay attention to the hours of enforcement for the meters. They're strictly enforced. Street parking is all coin-operated, but there are cash and card parking garages throughout the city.

Meetups

We're still looking for anyone that wants to head up some meetups this week. I'll hold off on a food/attractions/meetups email til Wednesday.
See you soon!
Dan
